intro: Galium fukuyamae, commonly known as the Fukuyama bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
